intro: Ludwigia adscendens var. montevidensis, commonly known as the Brazilian waterweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments and is often found in ponds and lakes. Due to its rapid growth, it can become invasive in non-native habitats.
